label: Description
value: Cape-like raincoat made of sixteen shaped gores with a stand-up collar. At the neck are cord ties with bone clasps; both are reinforced. At the waist is a cord loop with a circular reinforcement. The cord is knotted through the front of the coat. The coat was woven with very fine dark blue warps while the recycled cotton wefts are much thicker with varied shades of blue. The lining is an indigo-dyed double ikat of hand-spun yarns with a small repeating pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton (recycled fiber) Technique: plain weave Label: plain woven cotton warp with recycled cotton weft

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 93 × 344.2 cm (36 5/8 in. × 11 ft. 3 1/2 in.) W (at neck edge, excluding collar): 105.4 cm (41 1/2 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Purchase from Morita Antique Textiles, Tokyo

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund

label: Description
value: Vest which opens at the front; fronts connected to back by two twisted strands on each side. Hexagonal mesh of plaited recycled paper; handwriting on the paper reads as irregular black spots.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper Technique: 4-strand plaiting with 2-strand twists Label: Plaited paper

label: Provenance
value: Purchase from Morita Antique Textiles, Tokyo

Drapery Study for the Angel of the Annunciation

label: Description
value: Figure of an angel wearing a chiton tied under her breast and gathered at the hips, leaning left with right leg extended before left leg.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on dark cream laid paper

label: Description
value: Dramatic view of interior of Saint Peter's in Rome on Holy Thursday. View is from the right transept looking into the nave in which a large cross is suspended from the dome, composed of several hundred candles. Beneath the cross in the nave stand numerous figures; others stand and kneel in the transept. The illumination from the cross casts areas of light as well as dark shadows on the vaulted ceilings and walls.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache on cream laid paper, mounted on greyish-green paper

label: Provenance
value: September 10, 1926: J. A. Boussac [1]; Joseph Fuller Feder, New York, NY; 2009: acquired by Museum              [1] Lugt suppl. 729b; sale Paris, September 10, 1926 (as A. C. G. Lemonnier)

label: Description
value: Three tiers of graceful fountains of glass descend from the top, set off by swags of glass drops, the blown glass stems delicately engraved; gilt lower ring with six candle arms and an upper ring connected by the glass-surrounded stem and by three chains, all of metal, the lower ring supporting a blue glass disc at the base of the stem.

label: Provenance
value: Joseph F. McCrindle; 2009: bequested to Museum

label: Description
value: Upholstered seat and back with decorative brass nail heads, incised decoration on wood frame, the seat supported on diagonal front legs reinforced by a turned stretcher, slightly splayed back legs rise to seat back.

label: Provenance
value: Robert Kaufman [1]; 2009: acquired by Museum       [1] Former CHNDM librarian

label: Credit line
value: Museum gift in loving memory of Robert Kaufmann, by his sister, Catherine Tatum

label: Description
value: Asymmetrical arrangement of motifs, with central landscape view of a peacock perched on a balustrade under an arbor. This view is surrounded by other motifs include ceramic vases, potted plants and rondelle with interior view. Printed in metallic gold, red, black, brown and blue on an ocher ground.

label: Provenance
value: Was found in inventory of antiques dealer Arthur Robinson in Harrison, NY.  Was given to Gregory A. Kuharic by Robinson's niece.
Design for Stained Glass Window: Over Main Entrance - Lateral Building, Carnegie Hall, New York, NY

label: Description
value: Lunette filled with tiles of different colors; interior a torch flanked by pink C-curves.
